snippet: Disparaged as “little weasels” by Rudolph W. Giuliani in 1999, the furry pets are supported by Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration. The Board of Health will consider a proposal to legalize them this month.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration has proposed removing ferrets from list of banned pets in city, raising hopes of clandestine ferret owners; owning pet ferrets is legal in many areas of country, including New York State.
lead_paragraph: Disparaged as “little weasels” by Rudolph W. Giuliani in 1999, the furry pets are supported by Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration. The Board of Health will consider a proposal to legalize them this month.

headline.main: Ferret Fanciers, Ruffled by Ban, Are Eager for New York City to Lift It
